isis.stitle: Electrical System Troubleshooting Guide - 3300 Model - LIGHT SYSTEMS - STOP/TURN SIGNAL/HAZARD LIGHTS - FRONT TURN SIGNAL/HAZARD AND SEPARATE TURN SIGNAL LIGHT OUTPUTS FROM ESC

svcproc.title: FRONT TURN SIGNAL/HAZARD AND SEPARATE TURN SIGNAL LIGHT OUTPUTS FROM ESC

svcsubproc.title: Fault Detection Management

note.para: The testing method for troubleshooting the electrical systems portrayed in this manual is a basic voltage test. An alternative method of checking for voltage drops within a given circuit may be a quicker method of identifying an exact problem.
The virtual fuse in the ESC will trip during a short. To reset the fuse, the key switch must be cycled.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Front Turn Signal/Hazard Light outputs from ESC.

When the left or right turn signal is selected, the ESC will sense if the left or right signal circuits experience an over current (short to ground or excessive load) or open circuit (fault will only be logged when there is no current path through any bulb to ground). The ESC will log an active fault for either of these conditions. The fault will remain active until the condition causing the fault has been corrected and the affected turn signal is activated.

figure.caption: Front Turn Signal/Hazard Light outputs from ESC - Always Refer to the Circuit Diagram Book for Latest Circuit Information

calloutgroup.callout1: (1603) SYSTEM CONTROLLER LOCATED AT INSIDE RIGHT SIDE DASH PANEL
(4013) PASS THRU AT DASH LOCATED AT INSIDE LEFT SIDE DASH PANEL
(8000) RIGHT HEADLIGHT AND TURN SIGNAL LOCATED AT HOOD NEAR RIGHT HEADLIGHT
(8001) LEFT HEADLIGHT AND TURN SIGNAL LOCATED AT HOOD NEAR LEFT HEADLIGHT
(8003) HOOD/ENGINE LOCATED AT INSIDE LEFT FRAME RAIL NEAR BUMPER

table.title: Front Turn Signal/Hazard Light Connector Check Chart

entry.para: Right front turn lamps, less than normal low current but more than open circuit
Right front turn lamps, greater than normal high current and less than fusing current
Right front turn lamps has current flow when output commanded off
Right front turn lamp over current (Short Circuit)

note.para: Disconnecting connectors will cause new open circuit faults to be logged. Clear all faults after connections have been restored.

entry.para: Disconnect right headlight/turn signal harness connector (8000). Cycle key switch and clear DTC's. Turn on right front turn signal and check for fault. If the fault has not reoccurred, there is a short or an overload in the turn signal light. If the fault reoccurs, there is a short in the circuits between the ESC and turn signal light or in the ESC.

Disconnect any other connectors to components that are connected to the right front turn signal circuits. Cycle key switch and clear DTC's. Turn on right front turn signal and check for fault. If the fault has not reoccurred, there is a short or an overload in that component. If the fault reoccurs, there is a short in the circuits between the ESC and turn signal light or in the ESC.

Disconnect brown ESC connector (1603). Cycle key switch and clear DTC's. Turn on right turn signal and check for fault. If the fault has not reoccurred, there is a short in the circuits between the ESC and turn signal light. If the fault reoccurs, there is a short inside the ESC.
Right front turn lamp circuit open

para.emph: Right Front Turn Signal/Hazard Light Voltage Checks

entry.para: Check with hazard flashers on and right front headlight turn signal disconnected.

note.para: Always check connectors for damage or pushed-out terminals.
In an over current situation, the ESC will not supply voltage until the short or excessive load has been removed and the key switch has been cycled.

para.emph: Always use breakout box ZTSE 4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.

entry.para: Test Points
Spec.
Comments
Right turn signal connector (8000), pin D to ground.
Voltage switching from 12 ± 1.5 volts to 0 volts
If voltage is missing, check for open or short in circuits U57B, U57A, K57A, and A57A. Also insure proper voltage out of ESC.

para.hotlnk: Refer to ESC Replacement in this manual.

entry.para: Right turn signal connector (8000), pin D to B.
Voltage switching from 12 ± 1.5 volts to 0 volts
If voltage is missing, check for open or short to high in circuits U11-GA, U11-GB, and K11-GB.
If circuit check is good and the light is still failing, replace headlight assembly.
Left front turn lamps, less than normal low current but more than open circuit
Left front turn lamps, greater than normal high current and less than fusing current
Left front turn lamps has current flow when output commanded off
Left front turn lamp over current

note.para: Disconnecting connectors will cause new open circuit faults to be logged. Clear all faults after connections have been restored.

entry.para: Disconnect left headlight/turn signal harness connector (8001). Cycle key switch and clear DTC's. Turn on right front turn signal and check for fault. If the fault has not reoccurred, there is a short or an overload in the turn signal light. If the fault reoccurs, there is a short in the circuits between the ESC and turn signal light or in the ESC.

Disconnect any other connectors to components that are connected to the right front turn signal circuits. Cycle key switch and clear DTC's. Turn on right front turn signal and check for fault. If the fault has not reoccurred, there is a short or an overload in that component. If the fault reoccurs, there is a short in the circuits between the ESC and turn signal light or in the ESC.

Disconnect brown ESC connector (1603). Cycle key switch and clear DTC's. Turn on right turn signal and check for fault. If the fault has not reoccurred, there is a short in the circuits between the ESC and turn signal light. If the fault reoccurs, there is a short inside the ESC.
Left front turn lamp circuit open

para.emph: Left Front Turn Signal/Hazard Light Voltage Checks

entry.para: Check with hazard flashers on and left front headlight turn signal disconnected.

note.para: Always check connectors for damage or pushed-out terminals.
In an over current situation, the ESC will not supply voltage until the short or excessive load has been removed and the key switch has been cycled.
Always use breakout box ZTSE 4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.

entry.para: Test Points
Spec.
Comments
Left turn signal connector (8001), pin D to ground.
Voltage switching from 12 ± 1.5 volts to 0 volts
If voltage is missing, check for open or short in circuits U56B, U56A, K56A and A56A. Also insure proper voltage out of ESC.

para.hotlnk: Refer to ESC Replacement in this manual.

entry.para: Left turn signal connector (8001), pin D to B.
Voltage switching from 12 ± 1.5 volts to 0 volts
If voltage is missing, check for open or short to high in circuits U11-GD, U11-GB, and K11-GB.
If circuits test good and light is still failing, replace headlight assembly.

svcsubproc.title: Extended Description
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Front Turn Signal/Hazard Light outputs from ESC.
The ESC supplies battery voltage to the front turn signal lights.
Voltage for the right front turn signal light is supplied directly from ESC connector (1603) terminal B.
Ground for the light is supplied from ground stud (4037) to right headlight turn signal harness connector (8000) terminal B.
Voltage for the left front turn signal light is supplied directly from the ESC connector (1603) terminal C to left headlight turn signal harness connector (8001) terminal D.
Ground for the light is supplied from the ground stud to left headlight turn signal harness connector (8001) terminal B.
